review_title: Best Organization that supports Diversity & Inclusion
job_title: Business Development Manager in Toronto, ON
pros: You will be fortunate to work with genuine and intelligent people. Futurpreneur is an organization that values Diversity & Inclusion through its programs and for the employees. You will also be fortunate to work with different communities of entrepreneurs across the country. Lastly, in 2022, Futurpreneur moved its head office to a bright and brand-new office near Union Station. You will like it working from there!
cons: This is not a con, but as for many small organizations, you may want to continue your career in another organization after several years and different positions held.

job_title: Business Development Manager in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Futurpreneur is a non-profit organization with a healthy and positive working environment. Everyone is willing to help and support, which is great for employee's mental well-beings. CEO and team leads emphasize customer experience and social responsibility rather than performance, but everyone is self-motived and has a great performance. This is why working here is awesome - people have intrinsic motivation but not extrinsic motivation to help entrepreneurs and support the community. Plus, I love working from home.
cons: Different departments could have more communications to make work more efficient.

review_title: Great Environment! Don't let the earlier reviews deter you
pros: I had no idea what to expect when I first joined this organization. I have no idea why the earlier reviews are negative but that in no way reflects the culture nowadays in 2018. As far as work is concerned, your team is always willing to help and be flexible but you must commit to a team environment and be accountable. As a smaller organization, relationships are more personal than just being a number at a large financial institution. Colleagues are more genuine and very friendly and accommodating when you are going through personal/professional difficulties. 95% of the organization works a standard workweek and benefits are great too. Employer-matched RRSP and full health and dental with 0% paid out of pocket. There are various committees to join such as Social, Health and Wellness. Teams do regular activities outside of work. Salary is average for the industry but overall the culture and people are what make going into work enjoyable. Needless to say, work/life balance is very important to the culture here and it shows. You can really feel the entrepreneurial spirit in the staff here and many have gone on to launch their own businesses!
cons: The potential for movement within teams is limited, depending on your role. As a smaller organization, you would expect to be more engaged with what's happening with upper management and the general direction of the organization but in my view, more can be explained. The average tenure of employees at Futurpreneur is about 2.5 years.

job_title: Business Development Manager in Calgary, AB
pros: Work environment is friendly and flexible, and people are nice to each other. Good benefits for employees.
cons: So far, so good. Maybe some people do not like travelling, even though it is short distance travelling.

pros:
Working at Futurpreneur means working with a diversified group of people, speaking many languages and coming from all over the world. A lot of people working here speak French too. 
Each team's vibe is different depending on your manager and coworkers, but in general the vibe is pretty laid back; and working with young entrepreneurs makes it the more fun and interesting.
We have a new CEO coming from the MaRS Discovery District, she seems to like a transparent approach and wants to improve every area that needs it, this is pretty exciting.
cons: The biggest con to me is the office layout and lack of light in certain areas. We can work from home sometimes, but it's not that common so the office should be nicer. Some people have no access to natural light, which can take a toll on their positive attitude.

pros:
I was surprised to see all of the negative reviews on this page and honestly do not believe that those reviews accurately represent what it's like to work at Futurpreneur Canada. 

My favorite thing about working at Futurpreneur is being able to stand by its mission of helping young entrepreneurs start their own businesses as we continually support them throughout their journey, no matter what department you're in. I'm constantly surrounded by like-minded individuals who are passionate about helping Canada's economy through entrepreneurship, and I love that! 

Some pros that stick out at the top of my head are the comprehensive benefits package (health and dental are covered at 100%/health care spending account/RRSP company match), the Toronto office is in a really convenient location (right in the downtown core), learning and development tuition reimbursements, and yearly summer hour perks (working extra from Mondays - Thursdays for time off on Fridays). In addition, you get the chance to work with amazing and friendly colleagues. Since the offices are small and not so corporate, you get to know each and every one of your co-workers on a more personal level. It's very refreshing, especially if you come from a large organization with a lot of hierarchy.
cons: Like any organization, nothing is perfect and there is always room for improvement. Something that people can always work on in any organization is inter-department communication and more effective ways to engage and unite multiple office locations. In our case, we have our national office in Toronto and regional offices in QC and BC, with remote employees all around the country. It would be nice if there were more activities, events, and projects that revolved around connecting all employees.
